---
title: "Local Access (Recommended)"
---

## For New R Users:

1.  Download R and RStudio (Free).

    <https://rstudio-education.github.io/hopr/starting.html>

2.  Open RStudio

3.  Within the Console, type these pieces of code. After each line of code, highlight the line, or ensure the cursor is on the line of code. Press control/command enter to run it:

::: {.gray-box}
```         
install.packages("devtools")
```
:::

Once the installation has completed, a \> will appear in the console.

::: {.callout-note title=""}
It may ask you to download Rtools, but this is not necessary to use ProntoPCR. Disregard this message.
:::

4.  Next, type this line of code in the Console and press control/command enter to run it:

::: {.gray-box}
```         
library(devtools)
```
:::


![](images/clipboard-690767370.png)


5.  Similarly run:

::: {.gray-box}
```         
devtools::install_github("MarnieMaddock/ProntoPCR")
```
:::

This will load the ProntoPCR app from GitHub. It may ask you to update some packages. Press 1 and enter to update these. If this message does not appear, the required packages are up to date.

![](images/clipboard-2242457864.png)
